ygData.subject: Re: Now about 1hs vs. 2hs Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: Agreed I put stuff like bronze armour in them, that stuffs heavy and not valuable enough (to me) to worry about it.  I keep important things like food and my
ygData.messageBody:
Agreed I put stuff like bronze armour in them, that stuffs heavy and not
valuable enough (to me) to worry about it. I keep important things like
food and my backup weapon (BBC) in my backpack.

> ----------
> From: Jason Coan[SMTP:COANJ@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Wednesday, May 26, 1999 12:38 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Now about 1hs vs. 2hs Re: Rangers and
> warriors
>
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> or crash with 6 bags full of your parties FS weapons.....I quit using
> those bags in beta when I had put a BBC in one while making room and
> crashed and lost it. magic bags are great for carrying heavy low priced
> items, but NEVER EVER EVER put a magic weapon in one, or anything of
> significan value.
>
> >>> "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...> 5.25.99 2:41:35 AM >>>
> From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>
>
> > Weight also impacts your possible lootage potential; lighter 'carry'
> > gear/weapons = more loot to take back! This has got to be a good
> > thing, neh?
> >
> Two words for you - dimensional bags.
>
> Just dont do what I have done, log out with 5 full dimensional bags of
> loot.
>
>
